TopicTitle: Does anyone else do this? KB remap

Articles.Content:
On every new install of kerbal, I always go into the input menu and swap the yaw (q,e) with roll (a,d) and vice versa.

I suppose its mainly because its mainly a rocket game vs a flying sim.

but ALL my planes have rockets lol.
I find the default bindings more intuitive, especially for rockets.
I wish there was a way to toggle control modes. Like flight/docking modes, there should be a plane mode which would swap the roll and yaw controls.

34 minutes ago, worir4 said:

I wish there was a way to toggle control modes. Like flight/docking modes, there should be a plane mode which would swap the roll and yaw controls. 

As usual:

There's a mod for that.

Only things I remap ASAP is the rover controls to IJKL.
As a result of this remap any Kerbal in a command seat will have its helmel light toggled each time you turn right so I remap that to the default light key .

35 minutes ago, Tex_NL said:

Only things I remap ASAP is the rover controls to IJKL.
As a result of this remap any Kerbal in a command seat will have its helmel light toggled each time you turn right so I remap that to the default light key .

I should remap that. The only thing I remap currently is swapping I and K (inverted pitch for translation makes no sense). On my Macbook Pro I also remap precise controls to   ~ or Tab as Capslock doesn't work.

I assign NumPad 456789 to plane controls. So I use WASD for rockets and NumPad for planes.

Edited May 10, 2016 by Teilnehmer

I switch the rover controls to numpad / and * for steering, and + / - for gas/brake.

That allows for independent emergency gyro assist and RCS boosting without any key overlaps.  The + key is also located conveniently close to the top edge, making it easy to balance heavy things on it without blocking access to important keys.

(Yes, my rovers have a brick on the gas pedal for long trips.)
KSP is one of the few games where I remap NONE of the keys and change NONE of the default control schemes.

3 hours ago, HebaruSan said:

I find the default bindings more intuitive, especially for rockets.

Personally, I keep accidentally trying to fly aircraft in other games using Q and E for roll. This ended quite badly in Planetside 2, as E is the default keybinding for "exit vehicle." 

Mistakes were made.

I generally keep my keybinds stock, except that I usually add "stop timewarp" to "X" (not replacing "/", nor replacing the chop throttle), and I remap staging to tab.

I might do some minor remapping for docking mode (which seems to be mostly working again, but is using slightly different keybinds than what EVA kerbals use for some reason) in the near future..maybe.

I remap/mirror 2468 for WASD with 1,3 for roll.

I also mirror throttle up/down to Enter/'0' on the number pad.

EVA up/down is also Enter/'0'.

SAS toggle "F" is mirrored #5.

 

I'm mostly ambidextrous and it's easier to use the other hand on the far side of the keyboard instead of reaching over/between my other fingers to do things.

Edited May 11, 2016 by Mahnarch
wrong key
I don't remap my kb any more after starting to use an Xbox360 controller for the fiddly manoeuvres.

I use a Colemak keyboard:

So I remap everything. Even on QWERTY I prefer to map ESDF instead of WASD, so I use FRST here. It frees up a the Q and A keys to be hit by the ring finger.

The only change I make is to enable wheel controls in both docking modes.

I've now got so used to flying planes with Q/E that I have problems flying aircraft in other games.

The 0 - 9 Action Keys I switch to the Number Pad. I find those numbers a quick reach with my right hand.

Caps Lock = Throttle Up. Left Shift = Throttle Down. Left Ctrl = Normal/Fine RCS Thrust Toggle. 

In EVA movement I also use Caps Lock to Run or Up when using the Rocket Pack and Left Shift for Rocket Pack Down.
